intro: Fernandezia disticha, commonly known as the two-branched fern, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-branched inflorescence, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture and a bluish-green hue. Fernandezia disticha typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky areas.
